soundtrack.title: Königgrätzer Marsch
soundtrack.movie_title: Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade

search_query: Königgrätzer Marsch Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade

best_match.title: Königgrätzer Marsch (The Last Crusade Complete Score) - John Williams
best_match.channel: Erik Hillenburg of D/ND and The Histeria! Show

match_score.reasoning: Candidate 3 is selected as the best match because it is the only valid candidate that explicitly and directly links the 'Königgrätzer Marsch' to 'Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade' in both its title and description, without being an intentionally distorted version. While other candidates might have higher popularity for the march itself or more detailed historical context, they either lack the crucial movie context or are not currently published videos based on their future publication dates. Candidate 3, despite its low popularity and a minor imprecision in composer attribution, fulfills the primary requirement of matching the soundtrack to the specified movie.
key_factors: Video title explicitly mentions 'Königgrätzer Marsch' and 'The Last Crusade Complete Score', directly linking to the soundtrack.
Video description confirms the origin: 'It came from Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade (1989).'
The video is not an intentionally modified or 'earrape' version, suggesting an attempt at an authentic recording.
Unlike Candidates 1 and 4, this video has a past publication date, making it a currently existing and accessible match.
concerns: The video has very low views (139) and likes (2), which suggests it is not a widely recognized or canonical version of the soundtrack.

The title attributes 'Königgrätzer Marsch' to 'John Williams'. While John Williams composed the film's score and likely incorporated or arranged this march, the 'Königgrätzer Marsch' itself is a traditional German military march composed by Gottfried Piefke, not originally by John Williams. This is an imprecise attribution for the original piece, though understandable in the context of the film's score.
